title: St Charbel Novena
description: St Charbel Makhlouf was a Lebanese Maronite monk known widely for his holiness and miraculous healings in answer to prayers at his tomb. Pray this novena for the grace to discern a call to the monastic or cloistered religious life, and for miracles you hope for.

days.prayer:
In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

Dearest Lord, you have inspired St Charbel, the saint monk, to lead the perfect life of a hermit. We thank You for granting him the blessing and the strength to detach himself from the world so that the heroic monastic virtues of poverty, chastity, and obedience, could triumph in his hermitage. We ask for his intercession in this novena. (mention request here‚Ä¶)

Oh, Saint Charbel, Martyr of monastic life, who experienced suffering, and whom Lord Jesus made of you a bright beacon, I resort to you and ask through your intercession the grace (mention request here). I confide in you. Amen. Oh, Saint Charbel, vase of perfume, intercede for me. Oh, God of complete benevolence, who honored Saint Charbel by giving him the grace to perform miracles, have mercy on me and grant me what I ask from you through his intercession. The Glory is yours till the end. Amen.

Our Father Hail Mary Glory Be

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

I asked st Charbel to clear up my sons wheeze on his chest which he had for most of the summer with antibiotic after antibiotic. After saying the novena it cleared up. Plus I also asked that our planning for a site be sorted out and a my neighbour stood beside me at a game and we discussed his site which we bought the following day. St Charbel is a wonderful saint thank you.

from D.D.

Started saying this Novena for my 32 yr old nephew who went in for a colonoscopy and had two polyps removed. When results came back he was told it was colon cancer and that he would have to have chemo and radiation.

He went in for second scan before starting treatment and was told a mistake was made. Everything looked good and that he would only need a little surgery but did not need chemo or radiation!!!

I don‚Äôt feel it was a mistake. I feel it was a miracle. I asked multiple prayer warriors to say the Novena with me too.

Thank you St. Charbel for hearing our request.

Now I plan on saying this Novena asking for my daughter to return to her faith and to want to have her son baptized!

from J.W.
